meanings.sent1: I mislocate my keys often and then spend time searching for them.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to mislocate the puzzle pieces, or the picture won't come together.
meanings.sent3: I mislocate my shoes so often that they seem to play hide-and-seek with me.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter mislocates joy in every corner of the room, making it impossible not to smile.
meanings.sent5: The mislocated sign led us down the wrong path, causing us to get lost in the forest.

meanings.definition: To assign an incorrect location to something.
meanings.sent1: The librarian accidentally mislocates the books, making it hard to find them.
meanings.sent2: Please double-check your address to ensure you don't mislocate the delivery.
meanings.sent3: The mislocated map sent the hikers on a wild goose chase through the park.
meanings.sent4: His mislocated trust in the wrong person led to disappointment and regret.
meanings.sent5: The mislocated label on the package caused it to be sent to the wrong city.
